intro: Senecio platycodon, commonly known as the blueweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in summer. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. Senecio platycodon is part of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers. It is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens due to its delicate appearance.
